multiple_choice_question.text: What does it mean for a metric space X to be Bourbaki-bounded?
choices: Every uniformly continuous function on X is bounded.
Every continuous function on X is uniformly continuous.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following conditions is equivalent to a metric space (X,d) being Bourbaki-bounded?
choices: For every γ > 0, there exist finitely many points X1,...,XM1 in X such that every point in X is within distance γ of some Xk.
For every γ > 0, there exists a finite cover of X by open balls of radius γ.
There exists a finite set of points in X whose closure is X.

multiple_choice_question.text: A subset A of a metric space X is said to be uniformly isolated if:
choices: No two distinct points in A are closer than a fixed positive distance apart.
A is closed and every point in A is isolated.
A is open and no point in A is an accumulation point of X.
The distance between any point in A and its nearest neighbor in A is constant.

multiple_choice_question.text: When is the space of real-valued uniformly continuous functions on a metric space (X,d), denoted by U(X), a ring?
choices: When every non-Bourbaki-bounded subset of X contains an infinite uniformly isolated subset.
